hook.text: Toyota's factory method inspired software teams to visualize work and limit what's in progress.

buildup.text: Kanban boards show columns: to do, in progress, done. Cards move left to right as work flows.

discovery.text: Limiting work in progress prevents overload. Finishing one task before starting another increases speed.

twist.text: Teams resist WIP limits. Everyone wants to multitask. But science shows switching costs destroy productivity.

climax.text: Kanban works anywhere â€” software, marketing, even personal tasks. Its simplicity is its power.
